# Introduction

`std::unordered_map` is C++'s hash table container, providing $O(1)$ constant-time search, insertion and deletion operations with unique keys. In this blog post, I explore the basic API of `unordered_map`.

# Construction

`std::unordered_map` is a class template in the header `<unordered_map>`. 

```cpp
namespace pmr {
    template<
        class Key,
        class T,
        class Hash = std::hash<Key>,
        class KeyEqual = std::equal_to<Key>
    > using unordered_map =
          std::unordered_map<Key, T, Hash, KeyEqual,
              std::pmr::polymorphic_allocator<std::pair<const Key, T>>>;
}
```

It allows you specify a custom hash function and comparator at compile-time.
